Developer Frank Pankhurst was one of the world's leading architectural authorities and a major influence upon the early history of modern architecture. He designed everything from offices to hotels and homes, with over 800 commissions to his credit. From the beginning Pankhurst believed in making buildings architecturally distinguished to make them stand out from the crowd. Pankhurst had a lifelong interest in conservation and developed innovative techniques for repairing, altering and extending historic properties.
